Stock Indicators

Send in historical price quotes and get back desired technical indicators.
Nothing more.

Indicators Guide NuGet Package View on GitHub
« »

Aroon

Created by Tushar Chande, Aroon is a oscillator view of how long ago the new high or low price occured over a lookback window. [Discuss] 

// usage
IEnumerable<AroonResult> results =
  quotes.GetAroon(lookbackPeriods);

Parameters

name type notes
lookbackPeriods int Number of periods (N) for the lookback evaluation. Must be greater than 0. Default is 25.

Historical quotes requirements

You must have at least N periods of quotes.

quotes is an IEnumerable<TQuote> collection of historical price quotes. It should have a consistent frequency (day, hour, minute, etc). See the Guide for more information.

Response

IEnumerable<AroonResult>
  • This method returns a time series of all available indicator values for the quotes provided.
  • It always returns the same number of elements as there are in the historical quotes.
  • It does not return a single incremental indicator value.
  • The first N-1 periods will have null values for Aroon since there’s not enough data to calculate.

AroonResult

name type notes
Date DateTime Date
AroonUp decimal Based on last High price
AroonDown decimal Based on last Low price
Oscillator decimal AroonUp - AroonDown

Utilities

  • .Find(lookupDate)
  • .RemoveWarmupPeriods()
  • .RemoveWarmupPeriods(qty)

See Utilities and Helpers for more information.

Example

// fetch historical quotes from your feed (your method)
IEnumerable<Quote> quotes = GetHistoryFromFeed("SPY");

// calculate Aroon(25)
IEnumerable<AroonResult> results = quotes.GetAroon(25);
